Incident.Summary: FRAUD AT 23 MAIN STREET IN WALKERSVILLE.

IncidentSuppNarrative.NarrativeText: **CAR B-66 // Body-worn camera not available // In-Car camera not available** NARRATIVE: - MVA Printouts - MSP Form 89A Uniform Identity Fraud/Theft Reporting Form - Bank screenshot provided by victim VICTIM/COMPLAINANT: Victim #1: Grace Marie Carter (DOB 11/23/1983) Phone # Cell: 240-291-3141 23 Main Street, Walkersville, Maryland 21793 Victim #2: Kyle Aubrey Carter (DOB 06/22/1985) Phone # Cell: 301-471-8205 23 Main Street, Walkersville, Maryland 21793 Victims account information: (Joint Bank Account) Card Name/Holder: Nymeo Federal Credit Union Account #: Ending in 6009 WITNESS: Not applicable. NEIGHBORHOOD CHECK: A neighborhood check was not conducted due to the nature of the crime. SUSPECT(S): margin-bottom:11px">Unknown at this time. SCENE PROCESSING: At approximately 2017 hours, the call was generated for a reported fraud. At 2141 hours, I made contact with the complainant/victim by telephone (TRS). It should be noted the victim reporting the fraud resided at 23 Main Street in Walkersville, Frederick County, Maryland. I then spoke with complainants/victims by telephone, identified as Grace Marie Carter (DOB 11/23/1983), by her Maryland drivers license and Kyle Aubrey Carter (DOB 06/22/1985), by his Maryland drivers license. Verbal statements were gathered by telephone, and I gathered card information belonging to victim in the alleged fraud. I cleared the phone call at approximately 2158 hours. NARRATIVE: On 06/29/2023, at approximately 2017 hours, I (TFC Blumenauer #6357) of the Maryland State Police was dispatched to 23 Main Street in Walkersville, Frederick County, Maryland, for a reported fraud. It should be noted, the victim reporting the fraud resided at this address. At approximately 2141 hours, I contacted the victims/complainants by telephone, identified as Grace Marie Carter (DOB 11/23/1983), by her Maryland drivers license and Kyle Aubrey Carter (DOB 06/22/1985), by his Maryland drivers license. While speaking with Grace Carter and Kyle Carter by telephone, I began gathering details regarding the alleged fraud. Grace Carter and Kyle Carter advised their joint bank account for Nymeo Federal Credit Unit used by her and her husband was compromised. The account number for the account ended in 6009. While continuing to speak with Grace Carter and Kyle Carter, it was noted they were initially out $437.32 US dollars as result of this case. Grace Carter and Kyle Carter began to detail the facts in the case. Kyle Carter advised that on 06/25/2023, at approximately 2200 hours, he was using the bank application on his cell phone when he observed one fraudulent transaction on the account. Kyle Carter advised there were also other fraudulent transactions that were on the account. Grace Carter provided a screenshot from the mobile banking application. A copy of the screenshot was added to the attachments section of this report. The fraudulent transactions are as follows: Transaction #1: Date: 06/25/2023 Description: Security CMF Windsor Mills MD XX9054 Location: Carroll Motor Fuels, 1900 N Rolling Road, Windsor Mill, Maryland 21244 Total: $100.00 US dollars Transaction #2: Date: 06/27/2023 Description: Taylor Ave CMF Towson Location: Carroll Motor Fuels, 900 Taylor Avenue, Towson, Maryland 21286 Total: $100.00 US dollars Transaction #3: Date: 06/28/2023 Description: Canton CMF Baltimore Location: Carroll Motor Fuels, 4700 ODonnell Street, Baltimore, Maryland 21224 Total: $18.66 Transaction #4: Date: 06/29/2023 Description: Debit Card Dispute Provisional CR security CMF Carter Location: Related to transaction #1 Total: $100.00 US dollars Transaction #5: Date: 06/29/2023 Description: Debit Card Dispute Provisional CR Taylor Ave CMF Carter Location: Related to transaction #2 Total: $100.00 US dollars Transaction #6: Date: 06/29/2023 Description: Debit Card Dispute Provisional CR Canton CMF Carter Location: Related to transaction #3 Total: $18.66 US dollars TOTAL AMOUNT: $437.32 US dollars Grace Carter and Kyle Carter advised on 06/26/2023, they notified their bank of the fraudulent activity. Grace Carter and Kyle Carter advised they did not authorize anyone to use the account. Grace Carter and Kyle Carter also advised they did not authorize anyone to use the card, or give any card or PIN information to anyone else. While continuing to speak with Grace Carter and Kyle Carter, they advised they have not yet been reimbursed the money from the bank for this case. I advised Grace Carter and Kyle Carter to contact their bank, advise them of the fraudulent purchases, and inquire if they could set up a new account. Grace Carter advised the bank was going to set up Kyle Carter with a new debit card number since the account was compromised. At approximately 2158 hours, Grace Carter and Kyle Cater were provided the case number. I informed Grace Carter and Kyle to collect all fraud documents related to this case. At this time, I was unable to obtain the full account number for Grace Carter and Kyle Carters bank account for the fraudulent activity for this case. I cleared the call at approximately 2200 hours. All of the above events occurred in Frederick County, Maryland. CHARGES: Not applicable at this time. CASE STATUS: Case remains open pending further investigation.

NARRATIVE: On 08/02/2023, at 1419 hours, I received an email from Michael L. Jennings, General Counsel, for Carroll Independent Fuel LLC, in reference to this case. On 08/03/2023, at 1636 hours, Jennings advised that the company had reviewed the circumstances in this case with the alleged fraud, and the company was going to check their records for the transaction history. Mr. Jennings advised that employee Stephen Tompkins, POS Engineer, Carroll Motor Fuels, searched the companies internal databases, and was unable to locate any of the matching records that were provided by the victim, with the alleged dates and dollar amounts. CASE STATUS: Case suspended, lack of suspect information.
